{CROFTING}
Crofting has been the way of life in the Scottish Highlands for the past hundred years or so.
This way of life involves the keeping of livestock (mainly sheep and cattle). They are fed, at a great cost, during the winter months but during the rest of the year they are put out to graze on the relatively poor pastures. This land is called Common Grazing which is divided equally amongst the local community.
Crofting also involves planting crops such as potatoes, turnips and other vegetables which are used in turn to feed the families. This is referred to as subsistance farming.
